title: Bathtub

adjectives: Free from dirt or impurities; or having clean habits
verbs: Clean one's body by immersion into water
To submerge the body into water either for washing or for recreation.
To clean oneself by immersion in water or using water; to take a bath, have a bath.
To clean oneself by immersion in water.
nouns: A plumbing fixture that sprays water over you
An area in which one bathes underneath a spray of water.
Place in which a person bathes under a spray of water
The part of a shower where the water comes out.
A device for bathing by which water is made to fall on the body from a height, either from a tank or by the action of a pump.
A bathroom (or area within a bathroom) in which a shower is not surrounded by any barrier
A shower is a place in which a person bathes under a spray of, typically warm or hot, water.
Instance of using of this device.
Room for personal hygiene
A room containing a bath where one can bathe.
A room containing a bath or shower and usually a washbasin and toilet
A room with a toilet, but no shower or bathtub, and typically no sink; a water closet.
Room with a toilet (the device) and, typically, a sink, but no shower or bathtub.
A bathroom or lavatory in a home containing a sink and a toilet, but no bathtub or shower.
A room with a toilet (the device), sink, and bathtub.
A bathroom is a room for personal hygiene, generally containing a bathtub or a shower, and possibly also a bidet.
A room (as in a residence) containing a bathtub or shower and usually a washbasin and toilet
Large container in which a person may bathe.
A tub or pool which is used for bathing.
A bathtub.
Bathtub
A large container for holding water in which a person may bathe (take a bath).
A tub or pool which is used for bathing: bathtub.
A bathtub, bath or tub is a large container for holding water in which a person may bathe.
A large open container for water, in which a person may wash their body
A relatively large open container that you fill with water and use to wash the body

description:
A white bathtub with a silver shower head. Often depicted as a cast-iron tub with claw-foot legs. Commonly used for various content concerning bathing, washing, cleaning, and bathrooms more generally.

Several platforms, including Apple and Facebook, feature soap bubbles or suds. Samsung’s design displays streaming water from the shower head.

apple_vendor_description: Apple's bathtub emoji presents a clean, white, and elegantly curved fixture, reminiscent of modern bathroom design. The glossy 3D shading and soft rounded edges, hallmarks of Apple's visual aesthetic, make it appear inviting and substantial. On Apple devices, this emoji is commonly used to represent relaxation, hygiene, self-care, or a desire for a soothing bath.
